EDUCATION
Ph.D. Boston University, Sociology
In Progress
Dissertation Title: Unhealthy Trajectories: Race, Migration, and Health
Across Immigration Eras in the United States
Dissertation Committee: Sigrun Olafsdottir (chair), Jason Beckfield, Nazli
Kibria
B.A. Trinity University
Sociology, with a minor in Political Science, Magna Cum Laude
Afghanistan & Middle East
International Migration
Medical Sociology
Quantitative Methods
RESEARCH AND TEACHING INTERESTS
Race and Ethnicity
Health Disparities
PUBLICATIONS
Peer-reviewed articles
Olafsdottir, Sigrun, Elyas Bakhtiari, and Emily Barman. “Public or
Private? The Role of the State and Civil Society in Health and Health
Inequalities Across Nations.” Social Science and Medicine.
2013 Olafsdottir, Sigrun, Jason Beckfield, and Elyas Bakhtiari.
“Contextualizing Disparities: The Case for Comparative Research on
Social Inequalities in Healthcare.” in Research in the Sociology of Health
Care. Vol. 31.
2013 Beckfield, Jason, Sigrun Olafsdottir, and Elyas Bakhtiari. “Health
Inequalities in Global Context.” American Behavioral Scientist 57(8):
Book chapters and other publications
Olafsdottir, Sigrun and Elyas Bakhtiari. “Healthcare Policy and
Citizenship.” in The Palgrave International Handbook of Healthcare
Policy and Governance, edited by Ellen Kuhlmann, Robert H. Blank, Ivy
Lynn Bourgeault, and Claus Wendt. Palgrave Macmillan.
2014 Olafsdottir, Sigrun and Elyas Bakhtiari. “Social Construction of Mental
Illness.” In William C. Cockerham, Robert Dingwall, and Stella Quah
(Eds.), The Wiley-Blackwell Encyclopedia of Health, Illness, Behavior and
Society. Oxford: Blackwell Publishing Ltd.
2014 Bakhtiari, Elyas and Sigrun Olafsdottir. “Social Constructionism.” In
William C. Cockerham, Robert Dingwall, and Stella Quah (Eds.), The
Wiley-Blackwell Encyclopedia of Health, Illness, Behavior and Society.
Oxford: Blackwell Publishing Ltd.
2014 Bakhtiari, Elyas and Sigrun Olafsdottir. “Medicalization of Mental
Unpublished Manuscripts
Illness.” In William C. Cockerham, Robert Dingwall, and Stella Quah
(Eds.), The Wiley-Blackwell Encyclopedia of Health, Illness, Behavior and
Society. Oxford: Blackwell Publishing Ltd.
Under Rev. Bakhtiari, Elyas, Sigrun Olafsdottir and Jason Beckfield. “Institutions,
Incorporation, and Inequality: The Case of Health Disparities in
Europe.”
In Progress Bakhtiari, Elyas. “When Disparities Were White: Child Mortality
Patterns for European Immigrants in the Early 20th Century.”
Jonathan J.B. Mijs*, Elyas Bakhtiari* and Michele Lamont. “How
Neoliberalism Impacts Symbolic Boundaries in Europe: Global Diffusion,
Local Context, Regional Variation.”
*Denotes equal authorship
Under Rev.

Presentations
“Contextualizing Racial and Ethnic Health Inequalities,” Annual Meeting,

“Do Social Policies Matters? The Impact of Welfare State Intervention on

Montreal.
“Immigrant Acculturation and Health: A Latent Class Approach”, Annual

“Migrant Health in Europe: A Cross-National Analysis of the ‘Healthy

Europeanists. Amsterdam.
“Migrant Health in Europe: A Cross-National Analysis of the ‘Healthy
Immigrant Effect’”, International Migration Paper Session: Immigration
and Health, Annual Meeting, American Sociological Association. Denver.
“Are Immigrants Always Healthier? Evaluating the ‘Healthy Immigrant
Effect’ Cross-Nationally in Europe.” Immigration and Health Roundtable,
Annual Meeting, Eastern Sociological Society. New York.
